thread.title: It's time to start thinking about what Google will name Android O
thread.title_full: It's time to start thinking about what Google will name Android O

author: Raymond Wong
title: It's time to start thinking about what Google will name Android O
text:
It's time to start thinking about what Google will name Android O 0 2017-02-21 17:28:13 UTC 
Oh, Magic 8 Ball, what will Google call the next version of Android? 
If Google follows history, the next version will be called Android "O," and it'll be named after a dessert/snack like every other version before it. 
â€” Hiroshi Lockheimer (@lockheimer) February 20, 2017 
Seems like a lock-in, until you remember that Lockheimer loves to troll. Earlier in the month, he "teased" Android P with a simple tweet that read "#2018." 
â€” Hiroshi Lockheimer (@lockheimer) February 12, 2017 
Pocky , for those who don't know, is a popular Japanese stick-shaped biscuit snack. If you've never had it, you really should, because it's delicious and comes in seemingly every flavor imaginable. 
But back on topic, if Oreo isn't the name â€” it also wouldn't be the first time Google did a brand partnership (Android 4.4 KitKat anyone?) â€” what would you like Android O to be called? We made a little poll to get the ball rolling: OK @lockheimer is teasing/trolling us with Android O. What should it be? O-named desserts aren't very common... 
â€” Raymond Wong ðŸ“±ðŸ’¾ðŸ“¼ (@raywongy) February 21, 2017 
Cast your votes and make your predictions now, because we might not know until Google I/O in May at the earliest.
